title: Craving falafel in Springfield
body:
This is completely not Moxie related, but I need to get something off my chest...

I've been craving a tzatziki-drenched falafel gyro for the last three days, and apparently no restaurant in Springfield serves them. There WERE three restaurants that USED to serve falafel: Al Roubaie's, Wellspring Cafe, and the Acoustic Cafe, but they've all closed up shop. I called Riad's and Chicago Gyros and Deli to inquire about their falafel-making abilities, but they both acted as if I had asked them if they served poisoned biscuits. Perhaps it's a curse to serve falafel in the Queen City.

If anyone out there knows where I can sate my falafel craving, please PLEASE drop me a line. Thank you.
author: Dan

comments.author: DanerKebab
comments.body:
Ziggie's has a Greek omelet with a tzatziki-ish sauce on top, and a couple of falafel-gyro-like options on their sandwich menu.  You can get the whole menu on their website.

If you get really desperate, there are a couple of decent Greek places in Branson that may be able to help you out.

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: Nicole to the rescue! I will make Dan falafel! Huzzah!
